These are just amber-tinted sunglasses. Colored plastic.

True blue-blocking sunglasses will block blue light. When you put them on, anything that is the color blue will actually appear as various shades of gray.

You put these on, and there is no difference in color when looking at blue objects. When they claim these are blue-blocker sunglasses, they are lying to you.

I am returning these for a full refund. I am reporting these idiots to Amazon for scamming people.
summary: DO NOT BUY SUNGLASSES FROM THESE CON ARTISTS.....these are NOT "Blue-Blocker" sunglasses

reviewText: Love  this dress
Comfy

I was looking for a grey, longer top or tunic to wear with leggings.  I decided to give this one a try.  What I was looking for in this shirt is probably what a lot of people are looking for in a top to be paired with leggings: loose fit and long length (meaning:  covers my behind).

Ive worn this item twice, once with skinny jeans and once with leggings.  It really looked great with both.  The solid grey fabric really makes this a very versatile piece and Im considering ordering the black, as well.  I wasn't sure that I would love the shoulder cut-outs, but they are actually a cute feature.  Im happy to say that it fit my criteria:  its loose and covers everywhere I wanted covered

As far as quality, its decent.  I definitely wouldnt say its superior quality, but its not bad, especially for the price.
Moving to the fit, I really like the fit, but I definitely want to talk about sizing.  As mentioned in the Amazon listing, the seller requests that you use the sizing chart provided in the pictures to the left.  This is very important.  Im typically a 10/12 in shirts (which equals a 2XL  yeesh), but I wanted to make sure that it was loose enough, so I ordered a size up (12/14  3XL).  Im finding the upsizing really wasn't necessary because I think it would have been plenty loose enough had I just properly followed the size chart.  So, when making your size selection, you may want to take that into consideration.
Going back to the versatility, I think this shirt will be very easy to dress up or dress down.  I can see wearing this very casually, or adding some jewelry, hair, makeup and making this looked dressy.  I noticed in some of the other reviews that there were comments about using this as a T-Shirt Dress.  I wouldnt recommend this, but this just my opinion.  For me, this is firmly in the shirt category.

Overall, I am very happy with this shirt and will likely purchase this item in black.  I do want to tell you that I purchased this item at a reduced cost in return for my honest review, which I worked hard to do.
Im going to attach a picture to this review to illustrate fit.  I think it looks a little large (since I sized up and probably shouldnt have), but I still love the look and comfort of the shirt.
summary: Great Tunic.  Just be sure to use the size guide.

I ordered this Womens Off Shoulder Tunic is grey. The color is like heather grey. I really love the neutral color so it will match everything. The tunic is made with a cotton blend. The material is really soft. This tunic feels like a comfy t-shirt. I ordered a 14/16 because I wanted an oversize tunic to wear with leggings. Plus I wanted to allow for shrinkage.

Measurements of 14/16 (4XL)

Chest: 22 wide

Waist: 23.25 wide

Bottom: 24.75 wide

Length: 32 long

As you can tell by the measurements, the tunic it smaller at the top and flares out slightly as you can down. My chest is about 40 around and this size fits me perfectly and allows for the extra room that I was looking for. Im 57 and the tunic hits about mid-thigh. Its too short for me to wear as a dress in my opinion but perfect for leggings. If I wanted to wear with jeans, I would over one size smaller. This tunic is extremely comfortable. The open shoulder and flowy arms make it perfect for hot summer days. I absolutely love wearing this tunic with my leggings for many different occasions. It can be casual or even dressed up for a night out. I definitely recommend this comfortable and fashionable tunic. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Extremely Comfortable  Ordered a Larger Size for an Oversized Tunic with Leggings

reviewText: I ordered this 'dress' in a 14/16 (On the tag it's shows 4XL) because I wanted to make sure it had a nice oversized fit on me. I am 5'7, and normally wear a L or XL in tops and a 10 or 12 in dresses. While it is very cute on, personally I could not wear it without leggings underneath, or I'd be in serious danger of flashing someone! The size I ordered is perfect for the look I wanted to achieve. The only reason I took off a star is because there are a few threads coming loose at the very top of the sleeve (the part at the shoulder near the neckline) and pretty soon I feel that I may have to get my sewing kit out and fix that seam. I think I have washed this item 3 times so far (I'm a messy eater and I have kids) in cool water, on delicate cycle, low spin, and hung to dry...it has washed up quite nicely with just a tiny bit of shrinkage. The material is actually kind of thick, not sweatshirt-thick...think of men's tee shirt material, but way softer. This is actually nice because it is not see thru at all! This item would definitely transition well from Spring to Summer, and can be dressed up or down in a variety of ways.

It's from China, so if you wear a Large size dress in America, in China you're s huge xxxL size in roundness, and dresses are made to be short on a woman of 5'. (I'm 5'2" 140 lbs size large in USA dresses) I ordered size xxxL and it's loose on arms and the body of its loose, but it's super short, I think most buyers over 5' tall will either wear with leggings or donate it. I wore it as a dress twice and too many people told me it was just too short and it's no flattering to your figure. I tried it with a belt, but that makes it even shorter.
summary: for very short round bodies girls.,.

So now I have two of the same dresses because I had to reorder a size 6. This fits a bit better, more like a big size 4 if not borderline size 5. The dress itself is beautiful, very thick, lined dress. It's EXTREMELY long so you will definitely need to get it hemmed (I'm 5'5" and wear massive heels but I still needed a good 4 inches off). Also the zipper is pretty horrible. It broke just trying to unzip the dress to try it on for the first time. So expect to spend some more money on tailoring (the zipper screwed me.. I ended up paying an additional 80 bucks in tailoring). Other perks- it's a gorgeous dress. Jack, the seller, had been very accommodating in getting the dress to me asap. It's really a nice dress and price, especially for the cloth material and build. Things to watch for is that the lace is sewn on a bit loosely, the silhouette is a bit off from the picture- the sash sits way higher than the natural waist, and you will definitely need a bit of tailoring. But I guess considering its a 90 dollar dress that you'd probably find for 200 in stores anyway, you might as well. Just remember to get 1 size up before you're stuck with an extra dress like me.

reviewText:
This is a really cute costume, but it's a little too small for me. I normally wear a petite size 4. I'm 5 feet tall and weigh about 115 lbs...this is just to give you an idea of my size. I thought for sure a small size would fit me. I could barely get it over my shoulders. I drove to Walmart which is way out of my way (that's why I ordered through Amazon) and thankfully I was able to find the last two Scooby costumes with one being a medium. My arms aren't that huge, but it was still a snug fit around the armpits for a medium size.

BTW, when you take off the costume, I found it easiest to bend over and slowly pull it off. The arms take the longest because the fabric isn't that stretchable and you might have a harder time pulling those out. Maybe I just have big hands...???

This costume is made in China, so this small is probably accurate for them. Not for us. We have more in the hip area to cover among other places.

Overall, it's a cute costume and I got a lot of compliments on it. I added a blue bow to one of my ankles. The hood won't stay on your head on a breezy day. You might find glitter from the tutu to stick to your face. Not a lot...just a little. Took off one star because the size is not accurate. Otherwise, I liked it.
summary: Just a little too small for me

reviewText: Perfect costume for my daughter

While the Amazon listing gives normal American numerical sizes & I ordered the normal shoe size that I wear (which is 10 D(M) US), when I received the product the box was listed as Medium. The boots are a lot larger than any size 10 footwear I've ever tried to put on my feet. Evidently the numerical sizes in the Amazon description (8D(M) US, 10D(M) US, 12D(M) US, 14D(M) US) actually are the nebulous sizes Small, Medium, Large & Extra Large. I'm in the process of having custom inserts made by a local custom shoemaker so my feet don't start killing me after a few hours of wear, let alone all day at a Ren Faire. I do like the appearance of the boots. I'll modify my review after I receive my inserts & wear the boots to an all day event. In the mean time I suggest that Amazon changes the product description to more adequately inform any potential purchasers how these specific footwear are actually sized. Funtasma Men's Rob100/Bnpu Boot, Brown Distressed Polyurethane, 10 M US
summary: The product isn't made to normal US shoe sizes, don't expect them to fit normally even if your do order your exact shoe size.

reviewText:
I ordered the brown in size 6. Good dress if sized up! I would say the dress runs at least one size too small. I'm normally a size 6, but just had a baby a few weeks ago, so am more likely a size 8 now. I'm 5'4" and weigh 145 (usually 135) with an athletic build and a size 34E chest. I ended up ordering two sizes up to a 10 in the short sleeve version of the dress and it fits perfect! I wanted a more loose fit like pictured on the model rather than skin tight. If it's skin tight it will show any belly you have rather than hiding and flattering like in the larger size. Also, be warned that the dress does shrink considerably when dried in the dryer! Oops! Thankfully I tried it on beforehand. One other thing that bugs me is the way the wrap part lays across the chest. The line from where the chest part attaches under the breasts to the top of the shoulder does not match up when you put it on unless layed exactly in place and then it doesn't stay there, so there will always be a fold-over somewhere along the line. It's hard to explain, so I've attached some pictures. It's not terrible, just strange. Lastly, the top is wonderful for a breast feeding dress! It stretches out easily and goes right back to shape. I have actual nursing tops that don't work as well. So, if you're nursing, this dress is definitely good for the price just size up!

Pros: Very comfortable, super stretchy, love how the v-neck accents the chest but is covered enough to still be modest, fantastic for breast feeding!
Cons: One size too small, thin material so light shows between your legs even indoors, strange lay of wrap chest part, shrinks in dryer
summary: Has some issues, but GREAT for breast feeding!!

I only have two complaints.
1) The front pockets are too shallow. I have a smart phone with a 5 inch screen and it barely fits in the front pocket. I think the pockets would be ideal with pockets that are 1 to 2 inches deeper.
2) For the price they should offer more length options. The 34 inch inseam is too long ( I usually go with a 32 inch inseam) so I had to get them hemmed which isn't a huge deal but it would be nice to have a pair that would fit right from the get go.

reviewText: This backpack was purchased for my 2nd grader.  When it arrived I admired the strong canvas structure and the tough bottom.  I was happy to see that the bottom of the backpack wasn't made from canvas- perfect for it getting dragged around on the ground, thrown in lockers, etc. Her first day of school was Sept 10th.  By the end of September the little kitten paw on the small zipper had fallen off.  Easy fix- it's just a metal ring.  On Nov 30th, one of the zippers broke on the main compartment.  No big deal- there are two zippers for a reason.  Well yesterday, Dec 2nd, the 2nd zipper broke.  Mind you, the entire zipper.  It would cost more to repair the zipper than to buy her a new backpack.  However, kudos to the design.  My daughter loves the look of the backpack so much I have to buy her this exact one.  Grrrrr...
summary: Cute Design- Broken Zippers After 3 Months

reviewText:
One thing that I was looking for was that the iPad be protected, even if I take it out of the case for pictures, videos, or just to tote around. It is! It comes out of the zipper closure case, but is still protected by a leather sleeve. Any mom on the go, like myself will love this feature. I'm able to just slip it into my purse and not worry about it if I don't feel like bringing the whole case with me. However, the case gives it that extra protection if you use it, and don't want to put it in a bag or purse. Great for travelling.

The zipper case makes an excellent stand. I use it on my bed all of the time, and it works GREAT. Please note that side of the case that the iPad snaps into needs to be the side that is at the top when using it as a stand in order to stand as it shows in the pictures.

I would highly recommend this to anyone needing that extra protection. It also has a very professional sleek look to it. Any business professional would look great carrying this around. Again, you will not be disappointed in this product. Great job, rooCASE! Thanks for such a great product!
summary: Excellent Case, you will not be disappointed!

I would not hesitate to purchase this item again and would easily recommend it to others.

reviewText: Got lots of complements !!

This shirt looks fantastic at night, I have worn it to a few concerts/festivals and got lots of compliments.  The sensitivity wheel works great, you can adjust it's microphone level to the correct level no matter where you are (in relation to the speakers) so that the shirt responds perfectly to the music.  During the daytime it does look a little shoddy due to the fact that the light up part in the middle is just Velcro'd on (it is about a 1/16" semi rigid plastic square), but I didn't buy this for wearing during the day, and at night you really can't see the outline of where the plastic meets the shirt.  The shirt also feels to be of good quality material.  I guess the manufacturer could have done something better to conceal the seam where the plastic meets the shirt...But given the price I am very satisfied.
summary: This shirt looks fantastic at night

reviewText: It is light weight and protects my ankle very well. When I run on the court for one hour, I barely felt anything on my feet but felt comfort. Perfect gear for batminton!

I ordered 8.5 but received 9 instead . Too late to exchange as my daughter has to play in a tournament in just over a week and she needs to get accustomed using it. Other than that they are lovely shoes it cushions well during playing of badminton.

These are one of the best available badminton shoes now (spring 2016) and have been worn by a lot of professional players, so I really wanted to like them. However, they are on the narrow side. For ladies with wider feet like me, EX or LTD (unisex) models may fit better.

Edited a few months later to add that I have got used to the shoes and they are really comfortable. But several of my badminton friends have the same impression that this particular style tends to be very snug-fitting. So if you are already on the large side of a size, consider ordering half size larger.

reviewText: Very Nice Shoes

I unfortunately had knee surgery several years ago. While it's been getting better, it will never be the same. I've primarily used and trusted Yonex shows for badminton over the years. They've all served me well, but this is my favorite so far!

The shoe I used prior to this was still in pretty good shape, but I started to feel a little hesitant with some of my movements. I decided to get a new pair and I'm glad this is the one I picked up. My movement is great again! I feel more comfortable moving back to making a clearing shot or smash, feel more comfortable to move forward to deal with a dropped shot, and also feel more comfortable moving side to side as well. Needless to say with better movement across the board, I now have a better shot at winning more points!

A quick minor point in closing...I've only worn white shoes for badminton prior to this pair. A couple of players in my badminton club wore this and I decided it wouldn't be so bad to break that tradition though and get a flashy looking pair for a change :)
The lacing pattern is the best part of these shoes. A positive fit, good grip and good lateral stability.

fabulous shoes.

I was expecting these to come a little higher on the ankle than they did and at first they felt a bit uncomfortable since I'm not used to low shoes.  However after wearing them around the house for a few days, then using them for practice and playing a tournament, they were really comfortable and provided very good support and traction.  My feet felt fine they day after the all day tournament so these shoes definitely protected my feet.  Great traction as well.  I usually wear a size 10 and the Yonnex size 10 fit my foot perfectly.
I bought it for my brother and he loved it. it is really comfortable.

Good shoes for badminton so far. The only reason why I decided not to give 5-star rating is because they appear to sacrifice some cushioning capability to achieve lightness. I realize that I may be spoiled by my previous shoes, Yonex as well, which had better cushion at the expense of being somewhat heavy. Thus none of them gets best of both features, which is understandable.
summary: Good shoes for badminton so far

For those of you who are not familiar with these chips, they are injection molded clay composite (mostly plastic) 14 gram chips with a metal insert. Very similar to most inexpensive chips out there in the market, like the ace casino, the ultimate, and most claysmiths except for the Milano. They are similar in quality to the ace casinos. They look terrible when compared to some nicer chips, but for the price, these are ok. However, if you are thinking about getting a composite chip with metal insert, I would definitely recommend claysmiths.

reviewText: This is a great bag. Qualifies for Spirit Airlines carry on as a free bag. HOlds over 5 days of clothes.

Just what I needed for quick business trips of 1-2 nights. If the wheels were 360 it would be even better. Used it as a carry-on for Southwest Airlines, no issues going in the overhead bin, did not try to fit under the seat in front of me as I had my laptop bag. If you use packing cubes you can easily fit enough clothes for 4 days, 2nd pair of shoes and toiletry bag. Nice to have the telescopic handle while walking through the airport and then easily tucked away and carried onto the plane; no issue carrying it in front of me down the aisle of the plane. Was able to rest my laptop bag on top but I can see it being unable to support a top heavy bag without falling forward.
summary: Great Carry-On Bag for Short Trips

reviewText:
I purchased the Kemyer 15 Inch Underseater Carry-on Wheeled Luggage for a trip to Japan. It was a very smart looking blue and it was easy to wheel around and through the aisle of the plane.
Since it was a very long flight, I wanted something I could access easily when I needed something. The Kemyer 15 Inch Underseater Carry-on Wheeled Luggage fit the bill. It fit under the seat without difficulty and I was able to easily access items that I needed. It did hold more than my previous wheeled carry on.
I could it was easy to pack when it was laying down, so that I could more readily access them from under the seat. I think I might have been able to pack more but the zippers seemed to kink around the curves where zipped and I was afraid that they would break. . That is the reason that I gave only 4 stars.
summary: Kemyer 15 Inch Underseater Carry-on Wheeled Luggage

These boxer briefs are my new favorite. I previously had a style that Jockey made was was incredible but has since been discontinued and so these are my new go to.

I live in Florida and so heat and humidity are a normal part of daily life and cotton in boxers for me is a killer. The material composition of these are perfect as they breath great but are also not to thick or even to thin. I play soccer in these and go to the gym (crossfit) and have no complaints. The waist band is also great because it has good stretch so that it doesn't cut off circulation and has a good hold on my waist. The length of the legs are also great because I'm pretty picky when it comes to that. I have previously spent a lot of money on Trunk boxer briefs with short legs that usually end up turning into just briefs by riding up my leg. I have decently muscular legs but not huge so these are really in line with what I needed.

I give these boxers my highest recommendation as I stated, I can't stand cotton in my boxer briefs. Whether I'm heading to the gym or just going to dinner, these are what I wear.
summary: My favorite Boxer Briefs for Working out or Going out.

I like to sleep in a lightweight, no underwire stretch bra. I found these bras in a specialty lingerie shop, where I was fit into a 'full' size. I saw the size chart that said full was good for band sizes bigger than mine and cup sizes smaller than mine, which explains the fit of the cups (adequate) and the droopiness of the bra (meant for bigger band sizes) no matter how tight I make the straps. I suppose it's too much to ask for a smaller band, bigger cup size ( full plus junior?) version.

Summary:
- works for smaller band, larger cup in 'full' size than recommended in size chart. In fact, do not get the one size if bigger than DD even if band size is as small as 32.
- do not expect support, good for lounge wear or sleeping for large cup sizes
- I like the idea to wear over a bra for a camisole look
- get rid of the pads. As in, open the package, cut off the tags and pull out the pads and toss. They fold up in the wash, drift off in wear and are pretty useless.
- prices are better on Amazon than specialty stores
summary: Nice lounge or sleeping bra, only for the brave to wear in public with D+ cups

reviewText: I love it, so comfortable

Very soft and comfortable.

For reference, I wear a 38DD/40D depending on the bra, so I ordered the 'Full' size in the Coobie bra.  I hate bras with a passion and will almost always take mine off the minute I get home. However, when we have guests (family visiting for the weekend, etc..) then I can't because it definitely does not look right to be boppin around the house with the girls bouncing free-for-all under my shirt, not to mention maybe poking at the shirt a bit if I get chilled. This is where the Coobie bra is perfect, as it provides just enough coverage and support for casual lounging. I'll even sometimes wear them to Work under a heavier top, like a looser fitting sweater. You can't really wear them under anything thin or tight fitting because the little lining pads will show.  And there most definitely is not any real "support" so you can't wear them at the gym or for any activity that will have you bouncing. Since I bought them specifically for wearing around the house, they are what I wanted and expected.  I've actualy purchased a few more, though I will say that I prefer the original Coobie to the v-neck lace trimmed one, as they seem to fit just a tad better.
summary: Super comfy, but not very supportive.

I ordered the XL, but probably could have used a XXL on the top! If you don't mind the kind of tight "push up" effect, then order the size to fit your bottoms. I am 5' 3" tall, 105 lbs. and take a 32" inseam and a 26" waist which is a little big but are comfortable. I wanted these for work in a warehouse and they fit everywhere except the waist line. I put two 3/4" darts in the back of the waistline to bring it in. They are still big but comfortable. I am a very hard to fit body type and am used to having to "fix" anything I buy, that's why I didn't return them.

The seller was very helpful. I contacted them because I loved the red color and the x-small I ordered were slightly loose so I wanted to exchange them for the xx-small which were out of stock. I like a snugger fit . I'm 5'4", about 110 pounds . They said they would ship me the xx-small free of charge from their warehouse in China. I had also bought an x-small in black (drawstring waist) which fit me fine, snug but not tight, about the equivalent of a US size 0. For some reason the red pair fit more like a size 2. The material is pretty durable and a little heavier than what you normally find in the US. 100% cotton. No stretch but still comfortable. Good for Fall but I've worn them in 90 degree heat too. The label says no tumble dry but I washed and dried them and they didn't really shrink much, about what you would expect from a pair of jeans. I like that they have snap closures for the pockets and have a more modern, higher waist. Very cute. I would buy these again.

I ordered a Small I usualy wear a Medium but I wanted a tighter fitting shirt so I went with the Small and it fits just as I'd expected its not as tight on me as it is on the model in the picture since I am not as muscular as he is I am about 5'9" 131 lbs so the fit is perfect not skin tight like I was affraid it would be. (Next day UPDATE) Just took the shirt out of the dryer had it on the lowest setting this is the first wash and dry and the shirt did shrink nothing major but it is a more form fitting shirt now then it was before still a little loose in the hips but it is a bit more accurate to the fit on the model in the picture and same goes for the sleeves a snugger fit on the arms. If I was a bit more muscular it would be an exact fit as shown in the picture which is awsome, but from now on I will be hand washing and airdrying this shirt to prevent further shrinking as of now theres no obvious fading in the color I will update if that changes.

reviewText: I love the color and the hat.

**update: I tried to return the hat. After the restocking fees I would have ended up paying half of what the hat cost me, to actually return it and end up with nothing.
I guess it's nice enough to mow the lawn with, until the loose palm strands probably grow to holes in a few months.**

While the pictured hat is certainly a decent product without holes (just several loose strands), it is not what I received.
There are several reasons for this:
There are actually 3 "8 second" hats offered by Dallas Hats; none of them are what is posted in the seller's pictures;
The hat I received is actually called "8 seconds B." You can look at my pictures to know what kind of hat it is;
The hat "8 seconds R" somewhat resembles what is shown in the seller's picture, but the band is different, as are the vents on the crown (the Dallas Hats product's are roundish, while what the seller posted look like Xs instead).

I took some pictures for any possible buyers. Look up "8 seconds B" to get a decent look at what is being sold, or you can check out my pictures.
Not a bad hat by any means, but it is one I'll return because it is simply not what I thought I was buying in the  first place.
  Here is a link to the three aforementioned hats (sorry for the quality of the last picture, it came out really dark):
[...]

What the pictures DO show is a single small area of elastic at the top hem of the back.  If it was apparent that there was smocking, I would not have wasted my time buying both colors of this dress.

Dresses that cost this much should be properly tailored (as shown in the photos) and not need to rely on trash techniques like smocking for fit.  If the smocking had not been there, the dress would have fit beautifully instead of smashing my chest flat.

reviewText:
This is a very nice, high quality wallet. You can tell a lot went into the craftsmanship and the materials are excellent. The woven finish definitely brings a level of sophistication to the piece and the stitching is flawless. The reason that I deducted 3 stars was because it suffers from a huge design flaw that no wallet of this caliber should ever suffer from. Because this is an 8 credit card wallet, it's 4 cards per side. They card slits are horizontal and so when you fill this wallet with cards, it sits closed flush and has a tendency to twist because the area of contact between to the 2 sides is too small. What this means is when you pull the wallet out of your pocket it has a disheveled look to it because it is presented as "crooked". I'll live with this flaw but I won't buy another like it. I'll be stuck with this wallet for some time and I am ok with it because it is nice, it just has a messy look because the credit cards touch each other in a staggered formation when closed. This is "teaching" the leather a dis-symmetry that I will be fighting for the rest of the wallet's life.

I am including 2 pictures to illustrate my complaint - One of a side view to show how the credit cards sit against each when closed and one of the wallet a rest to show the effect of the design.

If Montblanc or the Amazon seller wishes to rectify this I am welcome to do so and would restore my faith in these companies, however I fear they likely won't respond and I'm stuck with a fancy wallet that looks sloppy.
Excellent!

I have been buying Mont Blanc products for over a decade, I bought this wallet 18 month ago, I use it in daily basis, a lot of the time I keep it in my backpack, still the Carbon Fiber starts to deteriorate quickly and eventually it will start falling apart. Don't waste your money with this, better go for leather.
summary: Don't get fooled with the "Extreme" name, the material is very cheap and poor quality.

These are very comfortable. I'm 5' 4", 112 pds., slender built and they're perfect!  Goodbye to regular bras that are restricting and uncomfortable!!!  I plan to hand wash these... no problem with me since I normally hand wash my bras anyways.  I'm ordering three more.  P.S.  I was pleasantly surprised when 3 bras arrived, white, nude, and "natural" color which looks like a very pale yellow color... I thought I had ordered 2.

These are the perfect bras for small-chested, petite women. Boutique bras made for petite ladies in small sizes are insanely expensive. Bras made for teens in small sizes tend to be too narrow, and the cup placement is too close to the center. Padded sports bras sometimes work, but they tend to make one look flatter. As Goldilocks would say, this one is juuuuust right. If you don't need "support" and can't deal with underwire, this is a comfy, stretchy bra that's just slightly padded and naturally rounded.

I've bought several sets of these and wear them everyday. My size is 34AA, so I was looking for a bra that would primarily provide nip coverage with a natural looking shape. I really like that the pads are triangle-shaped instead of a big circle. A lot of similar bras on Amazon in the same price point are too baggy, padded, or rounded so they look very unnatural with clothing.

Don't put these bras in the dryer, as that can ruin the padding. I put these in a small lingerie bag and then hang them to dry. No need to hand-wash though. Sometimes the padding shifts around, but there are small openings where you can reach inside and adjust the pads.

Another note: The "nude" color is a typical pale skintone color, but the "natural" color is a bright orangey peach.
summary: The perfect bra for petite, flat-chested ladies

I bought this for my fiance for Christmas. I knew she would love the pink camo. We are both professional truck drivers and travel for months at a time. I knew this would be the perfect all weather jacket for our busy schedules. She only wore the jacket twice. The second time she put it on, the zipper broke into 2 pieces. The zipper is just pressed together (not one piece). There is no possible way to fix it. The jacket is now worthless. It wasn't the wrong size or too tight. The size is actually very accurate. We stay out here on the road for 3 to 4 months at a time. We will no way be home in enough time to "return" it. So now I am out the money and she is very disappointed that she can't even use it. There's no way to zipper, or even fasten it closed.  Would consider submitting a new review if this problem was addressed.
summary: Zipper broke the second time it was worn!!!
